title: How to write a compelling speech on every child matters for 8-10 year olds - Quora

response.answer_text: How can I write a compelling speech on every child matters for 8-10 year olds? Here are some pointers. Use simple wordsHave one big ideaUse similesMake it interestingMake it shortWith that, you can make some starting sentences, something like Who has a pet cat or dog? (Wait for some kids to raise their hands) Okay. Did you know that some people think cats aren’t social, so dogs are better? Or that dogs are messy, so cats are better? But this isn’t true. You might be able to see where I’m going with this. This is the simile. Then you can go on with The same thing is happening with some kids, just like you. People think that, just because you look a certain way, you’ll be a certain way. But Every Child Matters is trying to fix that, along with other things. Obviously, you can include more details, but that’s the main idea. Every Child Matters

Read some children’s books to get a feel for the language you would use, keep it short, to the point, and age-appropriate. Compelling isn’t usually a word that would describe what eight-year-olds listen to. They like fun, upbeat stuff that aligns with their interests. If you know any friends with children that age, ask the parents what their kid is into. See if you can include stuff they’re interested in in your speech.
